story.title: Bedroomies - Episode 8
story.storyDescription: They're roommates who are never home at the same time. Let the flirty games begin...
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Chris Marie Green writes hot contemporary romance (like ‚ÄúBedroomies‚Äù!) plus urban fantasy. She also loves devouring pop culture and avoiding international incidents while traveling.

messages.text: Jenna clicks to listen to the first new voicemail from Adam, left last night.
Forget texting.
I just‚Ä¶I haven‚Äôt seen this tie since college. And these pictures‚Ä¶
He blows out a long breath.
Goddamn. These pictures with the tie‚Ä¶
He clears his throat.
All right. I know I wasn‚Äôt supposed to see all this. I‚Äôm sorry for barging in.
Now I can guess exactly what was going on in my bed before you left for the hotel, and‚Ä¶
Goddamn.
I‚Äôll leave your place now. Call me back. Please.
I‚Äôll wait until you do.
Jenna clicks on the second new voicemail from Adam, left that day.
You‚Äôll be relieved to know that I‚Äôm in LA. No use waiting around at your place.
God, I‚Äôm still trying to figure out what happened.
And I really am sorry for walking into your room when you told me not to.
There‚Äôs a heavy pause.
Just so you know, I couldn‚Äôt sleep last night, and it wasn‚Äôt only because of those pictures.
I wish I could talk to my friend Jen about this. Whenever you‚Äôre up to it, I‚Äôll be here.
Jenna scrolls through her texts from that day.
I realized that the idea of talking on the phone could be making you uncomfortable.
Texting works.
Can you please answer?
Five minutes pass.
You‚Äôre killing me, Jen.
Two hours later, Heather sets down Jenna‚Äôs phone on the sofa cushion between them.
Jenna‚Äôs eyes are red, and she‚Äôs hugging her knees.
Judging by those messages, he‚Äôs not giving up on you.
Adam‚Äôs only contacting me because he wants me to explain the freak show he saw in my room.
After I get up the guts to tell him, his curiosity will be sated and he‚Äôll be on his way.
He wouldn‚Äôt be that callous.
I don‚Äôt want to find out.
Sorry to be this difficult, Heather. It‚Äôs hard to talk about this, even to you.
I just hate that you‚Äôre back in that shell you lived in before Adam found your "me item."
Jenna lets out a shaky laugh.
My "me item." How vanilla compared to what he found this time.
And I‚Äôve been so good at hiding who I am until now.
I told you ‚Äî give him a chance. Maybe he‚Äôll tell you he‚Äôs into it.
If he is, then the novelty is sure to wear off soon.
Wait a sec‚Ä¶
First you were scared because you thought he might wig out like your first boyfriend.
Now you think Adam might welcome all of you, and that‚Äôs still not good enough?
He‚Äôs never going to win with you.
Let‚Äôs be real‚Ä¶
How can any man be interested in an oddity like me in the long run?
I mean, the only real, long-term relationship I‚Äôve ever had is with‚Ä¶
Jenna tears up.
‚Ä¶that damned tie.
Oh, honey.
Heather enfolds her in a hug.
You really do have deep feelings for him.
The thought of him possibly rejecting you has to be devastating.
To you, that tie WAS Adam.
It was here when he wasn‚Äôt.
What are you saying?
That you‚Äôve invested a lot more emotion in that tie than any of your previous objects.
Have you ever held onto something in your box for this long?
No‚Ä¶
Then maybe, this time, this particular prop is not just about sex but something more‚Ä¶
And that when Adam walked in and saw those pictures, you showed him your heart.
Jenna sniffs.
Feel better?
No! Now I sound even weirder!
Stop it. Just admit you‚Äôve been in love with Adam since college.
If this is love, I hate it.
Please. I know your parents taught you that intimacy is a dark, wicked thing.
And your first real boyfriend only drove that point home.
But now you have Adam to wipe all that away.
I‚Äî
The phone sounds off with Adam‚Äôs ringtone. They look at each other.
Do it.
Can‚Äôt.
Answer it ‚Äî now!
No!
It‚Äôs time to put an end to this one way or another.
Heather picks up the phone, hands it to Jenna, then marches out the door.
Jenna stares at the thing, her pulse flailing.
Heather is right. It‚Äôs time to put an end to this.
Hello?
Jenna.
I didn‚Äôt expect you to pick up.
I didn‚Äôt expect it either.
A massively awkward pause stretches over the line.
I miss you, Rosy.
I called to tell you that I don‚Äôt care about those pictures or the tie.
You don‚Äôt?
Well, that was what I intended to say at first, but then I realized it wasn‚Äôt true.
Oh. Well, that‚Äôs just great.
I DO care that when I found them, you were humiliated.
I‚Äôm sorry for that. I really didn‚Äôt expect‚Ä¶
What? The carnival sideshow that you found on my bedroom floor?
Don‚Äôt overreact.
Overreact? You said there was a little monster in me waiting to get out. So‚Ä¶
Monster, meet Adam.
You‚Äôre upset so‚Ä¶
No. You deserve to know every bit of this.
I like to get myself off with objects.
It started with a poster of Luke Skywalker and a tee shirt under the covers of my bed.
Then it moved on to Han Solo ‚Äî and I used another tee to get me off.
You don‚Äôt have to‚Äî
I‚Äôm telling you all of it.
I‚Äôm telling you how my parents would lecture me about treating my body like a temple.
And that I tried to tell my first boyfriend what I used to do with the Speed Racer tee shirt he gave me‚Ä¶
He kept my quirk a secret, but sure as hell avoided me at school after that.
That‚Äôs when I knew I wouldn‚Äôt get what I need from anyone.
You‚Äôre saying that you haven‚Äôt been intimate with someone since then?
I haven‚Äôt gotten OFF with anyone since then.
I have my toys and my props for that ‚Äî nothing else works like they do.
So are you intrigued now, Adam? Do you still want to talk about this?
Jen, you‚Äôre still upset‚Ä¶
Please don‚Äôt patronize me. It just makes things worse.
She imagines the appalled look Adam must be wearing.
It‚Äôs the same expression from prom night.
Tears well up from her chest and sharpen in her throat.
I‚Äôm going to make this really easy on you, okay?
She hangs up then turns off her phone, reduced to a weepy mess.
A couple hours later, she gets a text.
Are you ok? I haven‚Äôt heard from you.
It‚Äôs officially over.
Oh, hon.
I can put out a hit on Adam if he was awful to you.
He wasn‚Äôt. I was the bitch.
I hate me.
I‚Äôm coming back over.
Don‚Äôt bother. There‚Äôs no fixing this freak.
After I told Adam everything, I got out my "me item" to try and make myself feel better.
Lots of good THAT did.
What do you mean?
It didn‚Äôt work.
Dead batteries?
No.
Oh. You mean you couldn‚Äôt‚Ä¶?
Not even close. And that frustrated me even more.
I got out the tie and pictures. Hell, I even looked at the Stormtrooper eraser as inspiration.
Still nothing.
Oh no. What if you‚Äôve been so intimate with Adam that nothing else is EVER gonna work?
I hope not. But, shit, that‚Äôs probably why,
I need HIM, and nothing can take his place.
Ugh, I‚Äôm so sorry.
No, I‚Äôm sorry, mostly because I can‚Äôt take back the way I ghosted Adam.
Give yourself a day or so.
Intimate and sexual hang ups don‚Äôt get solved just like that.
But this one might require some sort of conversation.
I know.
Thx, Heather. You‚Äôre the best.
Hey, when the time comes for me to mess up this epically, you‚Äôll be there for ME.
Yes, I will.
Jenna leaves the box unlocked as she puts it away in the closet.
But what should she do now?
